Class ShoppingCart

  • java.lang.Object
    • ShoppingCart
  • public class ShoppingCart
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple shopping cart class that allows the user to add/remove items from a market to their cart and determine the price as well as get a summary of what is in the cart.
    Author:
    Aneesh Pandoh

    • Method Detail

      • lookupProductByName

        public static java.lang.String lookupProductByName​(java.lang.String name)
        Returns details of a specific product in the market given its name
        Parameters:
        name - name of the product to search
        Returns:
        A string representation of the product to search including the identifier of the product, its name, and its price in dollars if match found.

      • lookupProductById

        public static java.lang.String lookupProductById​(int id)
        Returns details of a specific product in the market given its identifier
        Parameters:
        id - id of the product to search
        Returns:
        A string representation of the product to search including the identifier of the product, its name, and its price in dollars if match found.

      • getProductPrice

        public static double getProductPrice​(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the price in dollars (a double value) of a market item given its name.
        Parameters:
        name - of item that the price is going to be looked up
        Returns:
        The price in dollars of the item, if no match was found in the market catalog, this // method returns -1.0

      • getCopyOfMarketItems

        public static java.lang.String[][] getCopyOfMarketItems()
        Creates a deep copy of the marketItems array
        Returns:
        Copy of Market Items Array

      • addItemToCart

        public static int addItemToCart​(java.lang.String item,
                                java.lang.String[] cart,
                                int size)
        Appends an item to a given cart (appends means adding to the end). If the cart is already full (meaning its size equals its length), the item will not be added to the cart.
        Parameters:
        item - - the name of the product to be added to the cart
        cart - - an array of strings which contains the names of items in the cart
        size - - the number of items in the cart
        Returns:
        the size of the oversize array cart after trying to add item to the cart. This method returns the same of size without making any change to the contents of the array if it is full.

      • nbOccurrences

        public static int nbOccurrences​(java.lang.String item,
                                java.lang.String[] cart,
                                int size)
        Finds the number of occurrences of a given item within a cart.
        Parameters:
        item - - the name of the item to search
        cart - - an array of strings which contains the names of items in the cart
        size - - the number of items in the cart
        Returns:
        the number of occurrences of item (exact match) within the oversize array cart. Zero or more occurrences of item can be present in the cart.

      • contains

        public static boolean contains​(java.lang.String item,
                               java.lang.String[] cart,
                               int size)
        Checks whether a cart contains at least one occurrence of a given item.
        Parameters:
        item - - the name of the item to search
        cart - - an array of strings which contains the names of items in the cart
        size - - the number of items in the cart
        Returns:
        true if there is a match (exact match) of item within the provided cart, and false otherwise.

      • checkout

        public static double checkout​(java.lang.String[] cart,
                              int size)
        This method returns the total value in dollars of the cart. All products in the market are taxable (subject to TAX_RATE).
        Parameters:
        cart - - an array of strings which contains the names of items in the cart
        size - - the number of items in the cart
        Returns:
        the total value in dollars of the cart accounting taxes.

      • removeItem

        public static int removeItem​(java.lang.String[] cart,
                             java.lang.String item,
                             int size)
        Removes one occurrence of item from a given cart. If no match with item was found in the cart, the method returns the same value of input size without making any change to the contents of the array.
        Parameters:
        item - - the name of the item to remove
        cart - - an array of strings which contains the names of items in the cart
        size - - the number of items in the cart
        Returns:
        the size of the oversize array cart after trying to remove item from the cart.

      • emptyCart

        public static int emptyCart​(java.lang.String[] cart,
                            int size)
        Removes all items from a given cart. The array cart must be empty (contains only null references) after this method returns.
        Parameters:
        cart - - an array of strings which contains the names of items in the cart
        size - - the number of items in the cart
        Returns:
        the size of the cart after removing all its items.

      • getCartSummary

        public static java.lang.String getCartSummary​(java.lang.String[] cart,
                                              int size)
        Creates a string representation of the summary of the contents of a given cart. The format of the returned string contains a set of lines where each line contains the number of occurrences of a given item, between parentheses, followed by one space followed by the name of a unique item in the cart.
        Parameters:
        cart - - an array of strings which contains the names of items in the cart
        size - - the number of items in the cart
        Returns:
        a string representation of the summary of the contents of the cart
